content.description: Crux is by the bolt. The main crack is 5.8 or 8+.
content.protection:
Doubles from #0.75 to 3, plus at least one #4 (a second one is handy for the anchor). The step around to the main crack can be protected nicely with 0.5 or 0.75 (I don't remember which) and/or a finger-size offset cam.

Descent is via the anchors at the top of the second pitch of Who Came First. At the top of the main crack, I'd suggest setting the anchor. Then scramble up 20' of easy (5.2) slab. Then boulder up another 15' to your left to a flat area to find the anchors. Note: these anchors don't have rings--I left some runners and biners up there (Oct 2018).  A 60m will get you to the top of the boulder that's the start of Who Came First.
content.location: Approx 30 right of Who Came First. Climbs thru a shallow groove with a single bolt to a dike.  Step around right to enter the crack.

climbs.name: Who Came First
climbs.fa: Craig Kain and Dana Brown, February 1988

content.description: a fairly sustained face climb on very good rock; you can rappel after the crux first pitch
content.protection: five bolts to a bolt anchor on pitch 1; one bolt on pitch 2

climbs.name: Who Are You?
climbs.fa: FA: Kelly Vaught, Frank Bentwood, Bob Gaines

content.description: Rising from behind a boulder at the far LH end of the platform below the other routes here (Pure & Easy, etc), this climb goes thru huecos and a horizontal in the first 15+ feet, eventually turning into slab and hugging the arete, and bending back towards the right to share an anchor with Odds & Sods.

climbs.name: Quadrophenia
climbs.fa: Craig Kain, Dana Brown, Tom Blanchard, Dave Kennedy; Feb 1988

content.description: Approx 75' R of 'Pure & Easy': it's a R-facing flake.  Then up a grainy face, past a hangerless bolt, to a "poor" rap anchor [per Bartlett -- a long time ago, and has probably gotten a lot worse.]
content.protection: Gear.  Might need a drill and hardware to replace bolts too!

climbs.name: Pure and Easy
climbs.fa: Craig Kain and Dana Brown FEB 1988

content.description: This route starts off just left of a left facing corner with a fist size crack. Move up past one bolt and then run it out.
content.protection: 1 Bolt, you may be able to place a nut and maybe a cam after the bolt but pickens are slim. Rap rings on top.
content.location: This route is on the NW face of Cunning Rock just around the corner to the north from a distuigishable tower with the route Who Came First on it.

content.description: a short, steep, strenuous finger crack. This route is not in 1992 Vogel guide.  Listed in the Barlett guide as being towards the LH end of this long face -- several hundred yards N of Odds & Sods.  Apparently it starts in a slot and therefore isn't visible from the desert floor -- best approached from the top, according to Bartlett.

climbs.name: Odds And Sods
climbs.fa: Dave Haber, Jim Hammerle, Sheryl Haber, and Alan Bartlett

content.description: a sustained face climb; grainy but with nice moves.  This route is not in 1992 Vogel guide.

climbs.name: Live at Leeds
climbs.fa: FA. Bob Gaines, Keith Bruckner. FA ( with bolts). Frank Bentwood, Kelly Vaught

content.description: Crux is getting to/past the first bolt.  A bit awkward.
content.protection: 5 bolts.  Bolt anchor w/ rap rings.
content.location: Approx 10 ft left of Pure & Easy.
